data.prayer: Father, make bold the prophets in Mombasa, Kenya so that the church can be equipped with truth and insight and a vision of your heart.
data.verse: These are the things which you should do: speak the truth to one another; judge with truth and judgment for peace in your gates.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Mombasa, Kenya

data.prayer: Spirit, help the church in the state of Mombasa do things that will multiply their numbers, not just add to them.
data.verse: But thanks be to God, who always leads us triumphantly as captives in Christ and through us spreads everywhere the fragrance of the knowledge of Him.

data.prayer: Spirit, give the believers of the the state of Mombasa unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.
Father, please raise up new apostles to pioneer the growth of the church in Mombasa.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Spirit, I pray that the Somali people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Jesus, 939,400 people live in the state of Mombasa. Please, give them 187 new simple churches this year.

Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Mombasa, Kenya. Show them that faithfulness is better than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.

data.section_summary:
the state of Mombasa, Kenya has a population of 939,400.

We estimate Mombasa has 465,982 people who might know Jesus, 283,912 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 189,506 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 2 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Mombasa to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

location.name: Mombasa
location.people_groups_list: Chinese, general, Arab, Yemeni, Hindi, Somali Ajuran, Nubian
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Chinese, general (35,000), Arab, Yemeni (36,000), Hindi (6,700), Somali Ajuran (232,000), Nubian (20,000)
